article:
William, Prince of Wales
==========================

William, Prince of Wales (William Arthur Philip Louis; born June 21, 1982), is a member of the British royal family. He is the eldest son of Charles, Prince of Wales, and the late Diana, Princess of Wales, and is second in line to the British throne.

Early Life
-----------

Prince William was born at St Mary's Hospital in Paddington, London, on June 21, 1982, at 9:03 pm. He was christened on August 4, 1982, at Buckingham Palace. His parents, Charles and Diana, had two sons, William and Harry, who were raised at Kensington Palace in London and Highgrove House in Gloucestershire.

As a young boy, Prince William attended Mrs. Jane Mynors' nursery school and later Eton College, a prestigious independent boarding school in Berkshire. At Eton, he excelled in sports, particularly polo and water polo, and developed an interest in geography and history.

Education
----------

After completing his A-levels at Eton, Prince William took a gap year, during which he traveled to Chile, Belize, and Africa, and participated in a British Army expedition to the Patagonia region. In 2001, he enrolled at St. Andrews University in Scotland, where he studied geography and graduated with a 2:1 honors degree in 2005.

During his time at St. Andrews, Prince William met his future wife, Catherine Middleton, who was also a geography student. The couple began dating in 2003 and eventually became engaged in 2010.

Early Appointments and Duties
-----------------------------

### Military and Air Ambulance Service

Prince William's military career began in 2006 when he was commissioned as a cornet in the Blues and Royals regiment of the Household Cavalry. He served in the British Army for three years, during which time he was stationed in Aldershot and participated in several military exercises.

In 2008, Prince William began training as a pilot with the Royal Air Force (RAF) and later became a search and rescue pilot with the Royal Air Force Search and Rescue Force. He served in this role for two years, flying missions in the UK and abroad.

In 2012, Prince William began working as an air ambulance pilot for the East Anglian Air Ambulance (EAAA), a charity that provides emergency medical services in the region. He worked for the EAAA for two years, flying missions and providing medical assistance to patients in need.

Personal Life
-------------

### Relationship with Catherine Middleton

Prince William met Catherine Middleton at St. Andrews University in 2001, and the couple began dating in 2003. They broke up briefly in 2007 but eventually reconciled and became engaged in 2010.

### Marriage and Children

Prince William and Catherine Middleton were married on April 29, 2011, at Westminster Abbey in London. The wedding was watched by millions of people around the world and was widely covered in the media.

The couple has three children: Prince George (born July 22, 2013), Princess Charlotte (born May 2, 2015), and Prince Louis (born April 23, 2018).

Duke of Cambridge
-----------------

In 2011, Prince William was created Duke of Cambridge by his grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II. He holds the subsidiary titles of Earl of Strathearn and Baron Carrickfergus.

Prince of Wales
----------------

In 2022, Prince William's father, Charles, ascended to the throne as King Charles III, and Prince William became Prince of Wales, a title traditionally held by the heir apparent.

Charity Work
------------

Prince William is involved with a number of charitable organizations and causes, including:

### Humanitarian Causes

Prince William supports several humanitarian organizations, including the Centrepoint charity, which helps homeless young people, and the Prince's Trust, which supports disadvantaged young people.

### Conservation

Prince William is a vocal advocate for conservation and wildlife protection. He supports several organizations, including the World Wildlife Fund (WWF) and the Tusk Trust, which work to protect endangered species and habitats.

### LGBT Rights

Prince William has expressed his support for the LGBT community and has spoken out against bullying and discrimination.

### Mental Health

Prince William has spoken publicly about the importance of mental health and has supported several initiatives to improve mental health services and reduce stigma around mental illness.

### Homelessness

Prince William has worked to support homeless charities and has spoken out about the need to address homelessness and provide affordable housing.

### Sport

Prince William is a keen sportsman and supports several sports charities, including the Football Association and the England and Wales Cricket Board.

Public Image
-------------

Prince William is widely regarded as a popular and down-to-earth member of the royal family. He has been praised for his charity work and his commitment to his family.

Privacy and the Media
----------------------

Prince William has spoken out about the need for greater privacy and has criticized the media for their treatment of his family, particularly his wife and children.

Titles, Styles, and Honours
---------------------------

### Titles and Styles

Prince William's titles and styles are:

* Prince William, Prince of Wales (2022-present)
* Duke of Cambridge (2011-present)
* Earl of Strathearn (2011-present)
* Baron Carrickfergus (2011-present)

### Honours

Prince William has received several honors and awards, including:

* Knight of the Garter (2008)
* Knight of the Thistle (2012)
* Air Crew Europe Star (2012)

Ancestry
---------

Prince William is a member of the House of Windsor and is descended from a number of European royal families, including the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha and the House of Battenberg.

Bibliography
-------------

### Book Contributions

Prince William has contributed to several books, including:

* "The Earthshot Prize: A New Framework for the Future" (2021)

### Authored Letters and Articles

Prince William has written several letters and articles, including:

* "A Message from Prince William" (2020)

--------

* Prince George of Cambridge
* Princess Charlotte of Cambridge
* Prince Louis of Cambridge

Further Reading

article:
Elimination Chamber (2023)

The Elimination Chamber was a professional wrestling event produced by WWE, held on February 18, 2023, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. It was the 13th event in the Elimination Chamber chronology and featured wrestlers from the Raw and SmackDown brands.

#Production

##Background

The event was announced on December 12, 2022, with ticket sales beginning on December 16. The name "Elimination Chamber" refers to the Elimination Chamber match, a specialty match in which a number of wrestlers are enclosed within a steel structure with a roof, with the objective of being the last person standing.

##Storylines

The event comprised matches that resulted from scripted storylines, where wrestlers portrayed heroes, villains, or less distinguishable characters in scripted events that built tension and culminated in a match or series of matches. The primary storylines were built on the two Elimination Chamber matches, one for the women and one for the United States Championship.

#Event

The Elimination Chamber event took place on February 18, 2023, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. The event was streamed live on the WWE Network and was attended by over 17,000 fans.

##Preliminary matches

The event began with a series of preliminary matches, including a match between Braun Strowman and Ricochet against Street Profits, and a match between Liv Morgan and Raquel Rodriguez against Ronda Rousey and Shayna Baszler.

##Main event

The main event of the evening was the Elimination Chamber match for the United States Championship, which featured Austin Theory defending his title against Seth "Freakin" Rollins, Johnny Gargano, Bronson Reed, Damian Priest, and Montez Ford. The match saw multiple eliminations, with Austin Theory eventually emerging as the winner.

#Reception

The Elimination Chamber event received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the action-packed matches and the surprise eliminations in the Elimination Chamber matches. However, some critics felt that the event was somewhat predictable and that some of the matches were too short.

#Aftermath

##Raw

The following night on Raw, Austin Theory celebrated his successful title defense, while Seth "Freakin" Rollins expressed his frustration at not winning the title. Meanwhile, the Women's Elimination Chamber match winner, Asuka, was confronted by Bianca Belair, who challenged her to a match for the Raw Women's Championship.

# Overview

The Saudi Pro League is the highest division of Saudi Arabian football and features 18 teams competing in a double-round robin format. The season typically runs from August to May, with each team playing 34 matches. The team with the most points at the end of the season is crowned the champion.

## Changes

article:
Associate international cricket in 2022–23

Associate international cricket matches are those in which at least one team is a member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) but not a Test-playing nation. The 2022–23 season began in September 2022 and ended in April 2023. This article provides an overview of the season, highlighting the various international cricket tournaments and series that took place during this period.

# Season overview

The 2022–23 associate international cricket season was packed with various tournaments and series, providing opportunities for associate members to compete against each other and against higher-ranked teams. The season began with the 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup EAP Qualifier A, which saw teams from the East Asia-Pacific region competing for a spot in the next stage of the T20 World Cup qualifying process. The season progressed with various regional tournaments and series, including the 2022 Women's Pacific Cup, the 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup Africa Qualifier A, and the 2023 ACC Men's Challenger Cup. The season concluded with the 2023 Victoria Series, which featured teams from Africa and Asia competing in a T20I tournament.

# September

## 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup EAP Qualifier A

The 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup EAP Qualifier A was the first tournament of the season, held in Vanuatu from September 9 to 14, 2022. The tournament featured five teams: Fiji, Samoa, Vanuatu, New Caledonia, and the Cook Islands. Vanuatu won the tournament, defeating Fiji in the final.

## 2022 United Arab Emirates Women's Quadrangular Series

The 2022 United Arab Emirates Women's Quadrangular Series was a women's T20I tournament held in the UAE from September 7 to 12, 2022. The tournament featured four teams: the UAE, Malaysia, Thailand, and Bhutan. Thailand won the tournament, defeating the UAE in the final.

## 2022 ACA Africa T20 Cup

The 2022 ACA Africa T20 Cup was a men's T20I tournament held in South Africa from September 15 to 25, 2022. The tournament featured eight teams: South Africa A, Nigeria, Kenya, Uganda, Ghana, Tanzania, Botswana, and Cameroon. South Africa A won the tournament, defeating Kenya in the final.

## 2022 ICC Women's T20 World Cup Qualifier

The 2022 ICC Women's T20 World Cup Qualifier was a women's T20I tournament held in the UAE from September 18 to 25, 2022. The tournament featured eight teams: Bangladesh, Ireland, Scotland, the Netherlands, the UAE, Thailand, Zimbabwe, and the USA. Bangladesh and Ireland qualified for the 2023 ICC Women's T20 World Cup.

# October

## 2022 Women's Pacific Cup

The 2022 Women's Pacific Cup was a women's T20I tournament held in Vanuatu from October 3 to 8, 2022. The tournament featured four teams: Papua New Guinea, Samoa, Vanuatu, and the Cook Islands. Papua New Guinea won the tournament, defeating Samoa in the final.

## Indonesia in Japan

Indonesia toured Japan in October 2022, playing a three-match T20I series against Japan. Japan won the series 2-1.

## 2022 Women's South American Cricket Championship

The 2022 Women's South American Cricket Championship was a women's T20I tournament held in Brazil from October 12 to 17, 2022. The tournament featured four teams: Brazil, Argentina, Chile, and Peru. Brazil won the tournament, defeating Argentina in the final.

## 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup EAP Qualifier B

The 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup EAP Qualifier B was the second tournament of the East Asia-Pacific region, held in Vanuatu from October 11 to 16, 2022. The tournament featured four teams: Papua New Guinea, Samoa, Vanuatu, and the Cook Islands. Papua New Guinea won the tournament, defeating Samoa in the final.

## 2022 Men's South American Cricket Championship

The 2022 Men's South American Cricket Championship was a men's T20I tournament held in Brazil from October 20 to 25, 2022. The tournament featured four teams: Brazil, Argentina, Chile, and Peru. Argentina won the tournament, defeating Brazil in the final.

## Hong Kong women in Japan

Hong Kong toured Japan in October 2022, playing a three-match women's T20I series against Japan. Hong Kong won the series 2-1.

## Rwanda in Tanzania

Rwanda toured Tanzania in October 2022, playing a five-match men's T20I series against Tanzania. Tanzania won the series 4-1.

# November

## Singapore women in Indonesia

Singapore toured Indonesia in November 2022, playing a four-match women's T20I series against Indonesia. Indonesia won the series 3-1.

## 2022–23 Spain Tri-Nation Series

The 2022–23 Spain Tri-Nation Series was a men's T20I tournament held in Spain from November 4 to 6, 2022. The tournament featured three teams: Spain, Germany, and Italy. Germany won the tournament, defeating Spain in the final.

## 2022 Spain Women's Pentangular Series

The 2022 Spain Women's Pentangular Series was a women's T20I tournament held in Spain from November 11 to 14, 2022. The tournament featured five teams: Spain, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway, and Sweden. Spain won the tournament, defeating Italy in the final.

## 2022 Desert Cup T20I Series

The 2022 Desert Cup T20I Series was a men's T20I tournament held in Oman from November 14 to 21, 2022. The tournament featured four teams: Oman, Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, and the Maldives. Oman won the tournament, defeating Saudi Arabia in the final.

## 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup Africa Qualifier A

The 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup Africa Qualifier A was the first tournament of the Africa region, held in Kenya from November 17 to 25, 2022. The tournament featured seven teams: Kenya, Nigeria, Uganda, Ghana, Tanzania, Botswana, and Sierra Leone. Kenya and Nigeria qualified for the next stage of the T20 World Cup qualifying process.

# December

## 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup Africa Qualifier B

The 2022–23 ICC T20 World Cup Africa Qualifier B was the second tournament of the Africa region, held in Rwanda from December 6 to 14, 2022. The tournament featured seven teams: Rwanda, Mozambique, Seychelles, Lesotho, Eswatini, Gambia, and Mali. Rwanda and Mozambique qualified for the next stage of the T20 World Cup qualifying process.

## 2022 East Africa T20 Series

The 2022 East Africa T20 Series was a men's T20I tournament held in Rwanda from December 10 to 15, 2022. The tournament featured three teams: Rwanda, Kenya, and Uganda. Uganda won the tournament, defeating Rwanda in the final.

## 2022–23 Kenya Women's Quadrangular Series

The 2022–23 Kenya Women's Quadrangular Series was a women's T20I tournament held in Kenya from December 12 to 15, 2022. The tournament featured four teams: Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and Rwanda. Kenya won the tournament, defeating Uganda in the final.

## 2022–23 Malaysia Quadrangular Series

The 2022–23 Malaysia Quadrangular Series was a men's T20I tournament held in Malaysia from December 16 to 20, 2022. The tournament featured four teams: Malaysia, Thailand, Bhutan, and the Maldives. Malaysia won the tournament, defeating Thailand in the final.

## Philippines women in Cambodia

The Philippines toured Cambodia in December 2022, playing a three-match women's T20I series against Cambodia. The Philippines won the series 2-1.

# February

## Singapore women in Cambodia

Singapore toured Cambodia in February 2023, playing a three-match women's T20I series against Cambodia. Singapore won the series 2-1.

## Bermuda in Argentina

Bermuda toured Argentina in February 2023, playing a five-match men's T20I series against Argentina. Argentina won the series 3-2.

## 2023 ACC Men's Challenger Cup

The 2023 ACC Men's Challenger Cup was a men's T20I tournament held in Thailand from February 24 to March 6, 2023. The tournament featured six teams: Thailand, Bhutan, China, Indonesia, Myanmar, and the Maldives. Thailand won the tournament, defeating Bhutan in the final.

## Isle of Man in Spain

The Isle of Man toured Spain in February 2023, playing a five-match men's T20I series against Spain. Spain won the series 4-1.

## 2023 ICC T20 World Cup Americas Sub-Regional Qualifier

The 2023 ICC T20 World Cup Americas Sub-Regional Qualifier was a men's T20I tournament held in the Cayman Islands from February 25 to March 4, 2023. The tournament featured four teams: the Cayman Islands, Panama, the Bahamas, and Belize. The Cayman Islands and Panama qualified for the next stage of the T20 World Cup qualifying process.

# March

## 2022–23 Hong Kong Quadrangular Series

The 2022–23 Hong Kong Quadrangular Series was a men's T20I tournament held in Hong Kong from March 8 to 12, 2023. The tournament featured four teams: Hong Kong, Malaysia, Thailand, and the Maldives. Hong Kong won the tournament, defeating Malaysia in the final.

## 2023 Pacific Island Cricket Challenge (Men)

The 2023 Pacific Island Cricket Challenge was a men's T20I tournament held in Vanuatu from March 9 to 18, 2023. The tournament featured six teams: Vanuatu, Fiji, Samoa, Tonga, the Cook Islands, and Tuvalu. Vanuatu won the tournament, defeating Fiji in the final.

## 2023 Pacific Island Cricket Challenge (Women)

The 2023 Pacific Island Cricket Challenge was a women's T20I tournament held in Vanuatu from March 9 to 18, 2023. The tournament featured five teams: Vanuatu, Fiji, Samoa, Tonga, and the Cook Islands. Vanuatu won the tournament, defeating Fiji in the final.

## 2023 Nigeria Invitational Women's T20I Tournament

The 2023 Nigeria Invitational Women's T20I Tournament was a women's T20I tournament held in Nigeria from March 26 to 31, 2023. The tournament featured five teams: Nigeria, Rwanda, Ghana, Sierra Leone, and Cameroon. Nigeria won the tournament, defeating Rwanda in the final.

# April

## Gibraltar in Portugal

Gibraltar toured Portugal in April 2023, playing a five-match men's T20I series against Portugal. Portugal won the series 4-1.

## 2023 ACC Men's Premier Cup

The 2023 ACC Men's Premier Cup was a men's T20I tournament held in Nepal from April 18 to 28, 2023. The tournament featured eight teams: Nepal, the UAE, Malaysia, Hong Kong, Singapore, Kuwait, Qatar, and Saudi Arabia. Nepal won the tournament, defeating the UAE in the final.

## 2023 Victoria Series

The 2023 Victoria Series was a men's T20I tournament held in South Africa from April 20 to 28, 2023. The tournament featured eight teams: South Africa A, Zimbabwe, Kenya, Uganda, Ghana, Tanzania, Botswana, and Cameroon. South Africa A won the tournament, defeating Zimbabwe in the final.

## 2023 Capricorn Women's Quadrangular Series

The 2023 Capricorn Women's Quadrangular Series was a women's T20I tournament held in South Africa from April 20 to 28, 2023. The tournament featured four teams: South Africa, Zimbabwe, Uganda, and Kenya. South Africa won the tournament, defeating Zimbabwe in the final.

article:
2023–24 UEFA Champions League

The 2023–24 UEFA Champions League is the 69th season of Europe's premier club football tournament, organised by the Union of European Football Associations (UEFA). The competition will be contested by the top-division champions of the 54 UEFA member associations, with the exception of Liechtenstein, which does not have a domestic league.

# Association team allocation

## Association ranking

For the 2023–24 UEFA Champions League, the associations are allocated places according to their 2022 UEFA country coefficients, which take into account their performance in European competitions from 2017–18 to 2021–22.

## Distribution

The top four associations in the UEFA country coefficients will each have four teams qualify for the Champions League. Associations ranked 5-6 will have three teams qualify, while associations ranked 7-10 will have two teams qualify. Associations ranked 11-12 will have one team qualify for the Champions League, while associations ranked 13-55 will have one team qualify for the qualifying rounds.

## Teams

A total of 81 teams from 54 UEFA member associations will participate in the 2023–24 UEFA Champions League. The teams will be divided into two paths: the Champions Path and the League Path.

# Schedule

The 2023–24 UEFA Champions League will begin on June 27, 2023, with the preliminary round and end on June 1, 2024, with the final.

# Qualifying rounds

## Preliminary round

The preliminary round will feature four teams, with the winners advancing to the first qualifying round.

## First qualifying round

The first qualifying round will feature 34 teams, with the winners advancing to the second qualifying round.

## Second qualifying round

The second qualifying round will feature 24 teams, with the winners advancing to the third qualifying round.

## Third qualifying round

The third qualifying round will feature 12 teams, with the winners advancing to the play-off round.

# Play-off round

The play-off round will feature 12 teams, with the winners advancing to the group stage.

# Group stage

article:
Indonesia's Next Top Model Season 3

Indonesia's Next Top Model Season 3 is the third season of the Indonesian reality television series based on Tyra Banks' America's Next Top Model. The season premiered on October 15, 2017, and concluded on January 28, 2018. The show was hosted by Luna Maya, who also served as the head judge.

# Cast

## Contestants

A total of 18 contestants competed in Season 3, with ages ranging from 18 to 25 years old. The contestants were selected from various auditions held in major cities across Indonesia.

1. Akira
2. Ayu
3. Dara
4. Dewi
5. Elvina
6. Gisella
7. Hana
8. Intan
9. Luna
10. Muthia
11. Natasha
12. Nia
13. Putri
14. Raisa
15. Rina
16. Shynka
17. Vania
18. Winda

## Judges

The judging panel consisted of:

* Luna Maya (host and head judge)
* Ivan Gunawan (fashion designer and judge)
* Deddy Corbuzier (magician and judge)
* Panca Makmun (photographer and judge)

## Recurring cast members

* Ayu Gani (makeup artist and hairstylist)
* Ery Makmur (wardrobe stylist)

# Episodes

The season consisted of 14 episodes, each featuring a different theme and challenge. The contestants competed in various photo shoots, runway shows, and other modeling-related tasks.

Episode 1: "New Beginning"
The contestants arrived at the model house and met the judges. They participated in a photo shoot and runway show, and the first contestant was eliminated.

Episode 2: "Beauty and Brains"
The contestants competed in a trivia challenge and a photo shoot, and one contestant was eliminated.

Episode 3: "Runway Rookies"
The contestants walked the runway for a fashion show and participated in a photo shoot. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 4: "Body Beautiful"
The contestants competed in a swimwear photo shoot and a challenge that tested their physical fitness. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 5: "Fashion Frenzy"
The contestants participated in a fashion show and a photo shoot, and one contestant was eliminated.

Episode 6: "Glamour and Glitz"
The contestants competed in a glamour-themed photo shoot and a challenge that tested their ability to work with accessories. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 7: "Nature's Beauty"
The contestants participated in a nature-themed photo shoot and a challenge that tested their ability to work with animals. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 8: "Urban Jungle"
The contestants competed in an urban-themed photo shoot and a challenge that tested their ability to navigate the city. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 9: "Vintage Vibes"
The contestants participated in a vintage-themed photo shoot and a challenge that tested their ability to work with props. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 10: "Beauty Queens"
The contestants competed in a beauty-themed photo shoot and a challenge that tested their ability to work with makeup. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 11: "Runway Rockstars"
The contestants walked the runway for a fashion show and participated in a photo shoot. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 12: "Fashion Forward"
The contestants competed in a futuristic-themed photo shoot and a challenge that tested their ability to work with technology. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 13: "Glamour and Grit"
The contestants participated in a glamour-themed photo shoot and a challenge that tested their ability to work with drama. One contestant was eliminated.

Episode 14: "The Final Showdown"
The last three contestants competed in a final photo shoot and runway show, and the winner was announced.

"Road to INTM Cycle 3" was a companion series that aired before the premiere of Season 3. The show featured behind-the-scenes footage of the casting process and the contestants' journey to the model house.

"Confession Room" was a companion series that aired after each episode of Season 3. The show featured the contestants' confessional interviews, where they shared their thoughts and feelings about the challenges and their fellow contestants.

## Video Reaction INTM Cycle 3

"Video Reaction INTM Cycle 3" was a companion series that aired after each episode of Season 3. The show featured the contestants' reactions to the episode's challenges and eliminations.

# Controversy

During Episode 1, Shynka quit the competition due to personal reasons. Luna, the host and head judge, was seen mocking Shynka's decision to quit, which sparked controversy among fans and critics.

article:
2022 Visit by Nancy Pelosi to Taiwan

On August 2, 2022, United States Speaker of the House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi led a congressional delegation to Taiwan, a self-governing island that is officially recognized as part of the People's Republic of China (PRC) by most countries, including the United States. The visit was widely seen as a significant development in the complex and sensitive relations between the United States, China, and Taiwan.

# Background

The relationship between the United States and Taiwan is governed by the Taiwan Relations Act, which was signed into law in 1979. The Act requires the United States to provide Taiwan with the means to defend itself, but it does not commit the United States to defend Taiwan in the event of an attack. The United States has maintained a policy of "strategic ambiguity" towards Taiwan, neither confirming nor denying that it would defend the island in the event of a Chinese attack.

In recent years, there has been a significant increase in tensions between the United States and China over a range of issues, including trade, security, and human rights. The visit by Pelosi to Taiwan was seen by many as a symbol of American support for the island and a challenge to China's claims of sovereignty over Taiwan.

# Visit

Pelosi's visit to Taiwan was part of a larger trip to Asia, which included stops in Singapore, Malaysia, and Japan. The delegation arrived in Taiwan on the evening of August 2 and was greeted by Taiwanese Foreign Minister Joseph Wu. During their visit, the delegation met with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen and other senior officials.

Pelosi's visit was widely seen as a significant show of support for Taiwan, which has been facing increasing pressure from China in recent years. The visit was also seen as a challenge to China's claims of sovereignty over Taiwan, which China views as a renegade province that must eventually be reunified with the mainland.

# Reactions

The visit by Pelosi to Taiwan was met with a range of reactions from different countries and organizations.

## United States

The visit was widely supported by American lawmakers and policymakers, who saw it as a demonstration of American support for Taiwan and a challenge to China's claims of sovereignty over the island. President Joe Biden, however, was more cautious in his response, saying that the United States was "not seeking to escalate tensions" with China.

## People's Republic of China

China was strongly critical of Pelosi's visit to Taiwan, viewing it as a challenge to its claims of sovereignty over the island. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said that the visit was a "serious violation" of China's sovereignty and territorial integrity, and that it would have "serious consequences" for the United States.

### Hong Kong

The Hong Kong government also condemned Pelosi's visit to Taiwan, saying that it was a "serious provocation" that would "undermine the stability of the Taiwan Strait".

### Sanctions

China imposed sanctions on Pelosi and her family in response to her visit to Taiwan. The sanctions, which were announced by the Chinese Foreign Ministry, included a ban on Pelosi and her family from entering China or doing business with Chinese companies.

## International

The visit by Pelosi to Taiwan was also met with a range of reactions from other countries and international organizations.

### Intergovernmental organizations

The European Union (EU) expressed concern about the tensions between the United States and China over Taiwan, saying that it was "important to avoid any actions that could further escalate tensions".

### Nations

A number of countries, including Japan and Australia, expressed support for the United States and its commitment to defending Taiwan. Other countries, such as India and Indonesia, were more cautious in their response, saying that they were "concerned" about the tensions between the United States and China.

# Interpretations and popular response

2022 United Kingdom heatwaves

The 2022 United Kingdom heatwaves were a series of severe heatwaves that affected the United Kingdom in the summer of 2022. The heatwaves caused widespread disruption, damage, and loss of life, and were considered one of the most significant weather events of the year.

# June heatwave

The first heatwave of the year began in mid-June 2022, with temperatures soaring above 30°C (86°F) across much of the country. The heatwave was caused by a high-pressure system that had developed over Europe, bringing warm air from the south.

## Impact on resorts

The June heatwave had a significant impact on seaside resorts across the UK, with many experiencing an influx of visitors seeking to escape the heat. Popular destinations such as Blackpool, Brighton, and Bournemouth reported large crowds and long queues for attractions and amenities.

# July heatwave

A second, more severe heatwave began in mid-July 2022, with temperatures reaching as high as 40°C (104°F) in some areas. The heatwave was caused by a combination of factors, including a strong high-pressure system and a jet stream that had become stuck over the UK.

## Impact

The July heatwave had a significant impact on various aspects of British life, including transport, retail, and agriculture.

### Transport

The heatwave caused significant disruption to the UK's transport network, with many roads and railways experiencing closures or restrictions due to the heat. The high temperatures also caused issues with air travel, with some flights being delayed or cancelled due to the heat.

### Retail

The heatwave had a significant impact on the retail sector, with many shops and stores experiencing increased demand for cooling products such as fans and air conditioners. Supermarkets also reported increased sales of cold foods and drinks.

### Berry farming

The heatwave had a devastating impact on the UK's berry farming industry, with many crops being destroyed by the heat. The heatwave caused berries to ripen too quickly, resulting in a significant loss of yield.

### Seaside resorts

The heatwave caused a surge in visitors to seaside resorts, with many experiencing overcrowding and long queues. The heatwave also caused issues with water quality, with some beaches being closed due to high levels of bacteria.

### Utilities

The heatwave put a significant strain on the UK's utilities, with many households experiencing power outages due to the high demand for electricity. Water companies also reported increased demand, with some areas experiencing water shortages.

## Aftermath

The aftermath of the July heatwave saw widespread criticism of the government's response to the crisis. Many felt that the government had been too slow to react to the heatwave, and that more could have been done to mitigate its impact.

# August heatwave

A third heatwave began in mid-August 2022, with temperatures reaching as high as 35°C (95°F) in some areas. The heatwave was caused by a combination of factors, including a high-pressure system and a warm front that had developed over the UK.

## Rain

The August heatwave was punctuated by periods of heavy rain, which brought some relief to areas that had been experiencing drought. However, the rain also caused issues with flooding, with some areas experiencing significant disruption.

## Impact

The August heatwave had a significant impact on various aspects of British life, including retail and gardening.

### Retail

The heatwave caused a surge in sales of cooling products, with many shops and stores experiencing increased demand for fans and air conditioners. Supermarkets also reported increased sales of cold foods and drinks.

### Gardening

The heatwave had a devastating impact on the UK's gardening industry, with many plants and flowers being destroyed by the heat. The heatwave also caused issues with water supply, with many gardeners experiencing water shortages.

# Drought

The 2022 heatwaves were accompanied by a significant drought, which had a major impact on the UK's environment and agriculture. The drought caused issues with water supply, with many areas experiencing water shortages.

# Wildfires

The heatwaves also caused a number of significant wildfires, which had a major impact on the UK's environment and wildlife. The wildfires were caused by a combination of factors, including the heat and dry conditions.

# Meteorology

The 2022 heatwaves were caused by a combination of meteorological factors, including high-pressure systems and jet streams. The heatwaves were also exacerbated by climate change, which is causing temperatures to rise globally.

# Media coverage

The 2022 heatwaves received widespread media coverage, with many newspapers and news channels reporting on the crisis. The media coverage highlighted the impact of the heatwaves on various aspects of British life, including transport, retail, and agriculture.

# Analysis

article:
Hogwarts Legacy
================

Hogwarts Legacy is an action role-playing game set in the Harry Potter universe, developed by Avalanche Software and published by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment. The game was released on February 10, 2023, for PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X/S.

Gameplay
--------

Hogwarts Legacy is an open-world game that allows players to explore the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry and its surrounding areas. Players take on the role of a young wizard or witch, creating their own character and embarking on a journey to master magic and become a renowned witch or wizard.

The gameplay involves exploring the castle, attending classes, learning spells, and interacting with other characters. Players can choose to specialize in different magical disciplines, such as Charms, Transfiguration, and Potions, and master various spells and abilities. The game also features a dynamic combat system, allowing players to cast spells and defend against enemies.

Players can also explore the castle's secrets, uncover hidden passages, and discover mysterious artifacts. The game features a day-night cycle and a dynamic weather system, affecting the behavior and difficulty of the game's enemies.

Synopsis
--------

### Setting and characters

Hogwarts Legacy is set in the late 19th century, during the late Victorian era, in the Harry Potter universe. The game takes place at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where players attend classes, learn spells, and interact with other students and faculty members.

The game features a range of characters, including teachers, students, and other magical creatures. Players can interact with iconic characters from the Harry Potter series, such as Nearly Headless Nick and the Fat Friar, as well as new characters created specifically for the game.

### Plot

The game's story follows the player's character as they begin their journey at Hogwarts. As a young wizard or witch, they soon discover that they possess a unique ability to wield magic and become a key player in the wizarding world.

As players progress through the game, they become embroiled in a mysterious plot to disrupt the balance of magic in the wizarding world. The player must navigate the complex web of alliances and rivalries between different magical factions, all while uncovering the truth behind the sinister forces threatening the wizarding world.

Development
------------

### Music

The game's soundtrack was composed by Peter Murray, with additional music by Alexander Brandon. The score features a range of themes and motifs inspired by the Harry Potter series, incorporating magical and mystical elements to create an immersive and enchanting atmosphere.

### Release

Hogwarts Legacy was officially announced on September 16, 2020, at a PlayStation 5 event. The game was initially scheduled for release in 2022, but was delayed to February 10, 2023, due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the need for additional development time.

### Additional content

Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment has announced plans to release additional content for Hogwarts Legacy, including new characters, storylines, and gameplay mechanics. The game's developers have also confirmed plans to support the game with post-launch updates and patches.

Reception
----------

### Critical response

Hogwarts Legacy received generally positive reviews from critics, with praise for its immersive gameplay, engaging storyline, and faithful recreation of the Harry Potter universe. Many reviewers noted the game's high production values, including its detailed graphics and atmospheric soundtrack.

However, some critics noted that the game's combat system and character customization options were somewhat limited, and that the game's storyline was somewhat predictable.

### Sales

Hogwarts Legacy has been a commercial success, with millions of copies sold worldwide. The game's sales have been driven by the popularity of the Harry Potter franchise, as well as the game's positive reviews and word-of-mouth.

### Accolades

Hogwarts Legacy has received several awards and nominations, including Best Role-Playing Game at the 2023 Game Awards and Outstanding Achievement in Game Direction at the 2023 DICE Awards.

Badin District
================

Badin District is a district of Sindh province, Pakistan. The district is situated in the southeastern part of the province and is bounded by Thatta District in the west, Hyderabad District in the north, Mirpur Khas District in the east, and the Arabian Sea in the south. The district is known for its rich history, cultural heritage, and natural resources.

History
-------

The history of Badin District dates back to the ancient Indus Valley Civilization. The district was an important center of trade and commerce during the ancient times. In the 8th century, the district was conquered by the Arabs, who introduced Islam to the region. During the Mughal era, the district was a major center of learning and culture. The British East India Company occupied the district in the 19th century, and it remained under British rule until the independence of Pakistan in 1947.

Demographics
------------

### Religion

The majority of the population of Badin District is Muslim, with a significant minority of Hindus. The district is also home to a small community of Christians.

### Language

The main language spoken in Badin District is Sindhi, which is the official language of the province. Urdu is also widely spoken, and English is used as a secondary language for official purposes.

Administration
--------------

### List of Tehsils

Badin District is divided into five tehsils:

1. Badin Tehsil
2. Golarchi Tehsil
3. Matli Tehsil
4. Nindo Shahar Tehsil
5. Tando Bago Tehsil

### List of Union Councils

The district is further divided into 46 union councils.

### List of Dehs

The district is divided into 455 dehs, which are the smallest administrative units in the district.

Education
----------

Badin District has a literacy rate of 45%, which is lower than the national average. The district has a number of educational institutions, including schools, colleges, and universities. The district is home to the University of Sindh, which is one of the oldest universities in the province.

Economy
--------

### Railways

The district is connected to the rest of the country by a railway line, which passes through the town of Badin. The railway line provides a convenient mode of transportation for passengers and goods.

### Badin Coal Field

The district is home to the Badin Coal Field, which is one of the largest coal fields in the province. The coal field is operated by the Sindh Coal Authority, which is a government-owned organization. The coal field provides employment opportunities to thousands of people in the district and contributes to the economy of the province.

Opinion Polling for the 2022 French Presidential Election

The 2022 French presidential election was held on April 10, 2022, with a runoff on April 24, 2022. Opinion polling for the election was conducted by various organizations and media outlets to gauge the voting intentions of the French public. This article presents a summary of the polls conducted for the first and second rounds of the election.

# First Round

## Graphical Summary

The following graphical summary presents the average polling numbers for the top five candidates in the first round of the election, based on polls conducted between January 2022 and April 2022.

[Insert Graphical Summary]

## 2022

### Official Campaign

The official campaign for the 2022 French presidential election began on March 28, 2022. During this period, several polls were conducted to assess the voting intentions of the French public.

In a poll conducted by IFOP on March 28-30, 2022, Emmanuel Macron led the pack with 26% of the vote, followed by Marine Le Pen with 23%, Jean-Luc Mélenchon with 17%, Éric Zemmour with 12%, and Valérie Pécresse with 9%.

A poll conducted by Harris Interactive on March 29-31, 2022, gave Macron 27% of the vote, Le Pen 24%, Mélenchon 18%, Zemmour 12%, and Pécresse 9%.

### March

In a poll conducted by Ipsos on March 18-22, 2022, Macron led with 28% of the vote, followed by Le Pen with 25%, Mélenchon with 18%, Zemmour with 12%, and Pécresse with 8%.

A poll conducted by Odoxa on March 15-17, 2022, gave Macron 29% of the vote, Le Pen 26%, Mélenchon 18%, Zemmour 12%, and Pécresse 7%.

### February

In a poll conducted by BVA on February 14-16, 2022, Macron led with 30% of the vote, followed by Le Pen with 27%, Mélenchon with 19%, Zemmour with 12%, and Pécresse with 6%.

A poll conducted by IFOP on February 7-9, 2022, gave Macron 31% of the vote, Le Pen 28%, Mélenchon 19%, Zemmour 12%, and Pécresse 5%.

### January

In a poll conducted by Harris Interactive on January 17-19, 2022, Macron led with 32% of the vote, followed by Le Pen with 29%, Mélenchon with 19%, Zemmour with 11%, and Pécresse with 4%.

A poll conducted by Ipsos on January 14-18, 2022, gave Macron 33% of the vote, Le Pen 30%, Mélenchon 19%, Zemmour 11%, and Pécresse 3%.

## 2021

### December

In a poll conducted by Odoxa on December 13-15, 2021, Macron led with 34% of the vote, followed by Le Pen with 31%, Mélenchon with 20%, Zemmour with 10%, and Pécresse with 2%.

A poll conducted by BVA on December 6-8, 2021, gave Macron 35% of the vote, Le Pen 32%, Mélenchon 20%, Zemmour 9%, and Pécresse 1%.

### September–November

In a poll conducted by IFOP on November 22-24, 2021, Macron led with 36% of the vote, followed by Le Pen with 33%, Mélenchon with 20%, Zemmour with 8%, and Pécresse with 1%.

2023 Rugby World Cup statistics

The 2023 Rugby World Cup was the tenth edition of the Rugby World Cup, the quadrennial international rugby union championship. The tournament was held in France from September 8 to October 28, 2023. A total of 20 teams competed in the tournament, with South Africa winning the championship by defeating New Zealand 12-11 in the final.

# Team statistics

The 2023 Rugby World Cup featured 20 teams, each playing a minimum of four matches in the pool stage. The teams were divided into four pools of five teams each, with the top two teams from each pool advancing to the knockout stage. The team statistics include the number of matches played, won, lost, and drawn, as well as the number of points scored and conceded.

article:
Hurricane Ian

Hurricane Ian was a powerful and destructive tropical cyclone that affected the Caribbean and the southeastern United States in September 2022. The storm caused catastrophic damage and loss of life in several countries, particularly in Cuba and Florida.

#Meteorological history

Hurricane Ian formed as a tropical wave in the eastern Caribbean on September 19, 2022. The wave moved westward and developed into a tropical depression on September 23. The depression strengthened into a tropical storm later that day, and was given the name Ian. Over the next few days, Ian moved through the Caribbean, passing south of Jamaica and the Cayman Islands.

On September 26, Ian made landfall in western Cuba as a Category 3 hurricane. The storm caused widespread damage and power outages across the island. After moving through Cuba, Ian emerged into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, where it strengthened into a Category 4 hurricane.

Ian made landfall in southwestern Florida on September 28, causing catastrophic damage and flooding. The storm made a second landfall in eastern South Carolina on September 30, causing significant damage and power outages.

#Preparations

##Caribbean

###Jamaica

The government of Jamaica issued a tropical storm watch on September 23, as Ian was forecast to pass south of the island. Residents were advised to stock up on food and water, and to prepare for possible power outages.

###Cayman Islands

The government of the Cayman Islands issued a hurricane warning on September 24, as Ian was forecast to pass close to the islands. Residents were advised to evacuate to safe zones, and to prepare for possible flooding and power outages.

###Cuba

The government of Cuba issued a hurricane warning on September 25, as Ian was forecast to make landfall in western Cuba. Residents were advised to evacuate to safe zones, and to prepare for possible flooding and power outages.

##United States

###Florida

The government of Florida issued a state of emergency on September 23, as Ian was forecast to make landfall in the state. Residents were advised to evacuate to safe zones, and to prepare for possible flooding and power outages.

###Georgia

The government of Georgia issued a state of emergency on September 26, as Ian was forecast to bring heavy rain and strong winds to the state. Residents were advised to prepare for possible power outages and flooding.

###South Carolina

The government of South Carolina issued a state of emergency on September 26, as Ian was forecast to make landfall in the state. Residents were advised to evacuate to safe zones, and to prepare for possible flooding and power outages.

###Elsewhere

Other states in the southeastern United States, including North Carolina and Virginia, also issued states of emergency and advised residents to prepare for possible heavy rain and strong winds.

##The Bahamas

The government of the Bahamas issued a tropical storm watch on September 24, as Ian was forecast to pass close to the islands. Residents were advised to stock up on food and water, and to prepare for possible power outages.

#Impact

##Caribbean

###Southern Caribbean and South America

Ian brought heavy rain and strong winds to several countries in the southern Caribbean and South America, including Trinidad and Tobago, Guyana, and Venezuela. The storm caused significant damage and power outages in these countries.

###Cayman Islands

Ian passed close to the Cayman Islands on September 26, causing significant damage and power outages. The storm surge caused flooding in several areas, including the capital city of George Town.

###Cuba

Ian made landfall in western Cuba on September 26, causing widespread damage and power outages. The storm surge caused flooding in several areas, including the city of Pinar del Río. The government of Cuba reported that the storm caused $3 billion in damages.

##United States

###Florida

Ian made landfall in southwestern Florida on September 28, causing catastrophic damage and flooding. The storm surge caused flooding in several areas, including the cities of Fort Myers and Cape Coral. The government of Florida reported that the storm caused $50 billion in damages.

###The Carolinas

Ian made landfall in eastern South Carolina on September 30, causing significant damage and power outages. The storm surge caused flooding in several areas, including the city of Charleston. The government of South Carolina reported that the storm caused $1 billion in damages.

###Elsewhere

Ian also caused significant damage and power outages in other states in the southeastern United States, including Georgia and North Carolina.

#Aftermath

##Cuba

The government of Cuba declared a state of emergency after Ian made landfall in western Cuba. The government deployed troops and emergency responders to affected areas, and provided aid to residents.

##United States

The government of the United States declared a state of emergency in Florida and South Carolina after Ian made landfall in these states. The government deployed troops and emergency responders to affected areas, and provided aid to residents.

###Damage estimates

The total damage from Ian is estimated to be over $60 billion, making it one of the costliest hurricanes in U.S. history. The storm caused significant damage to infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and buildings.

#Depiction in media

Ian was widely covered in the media, with many news outlets providing live coverage of the storm's landfall and aftermath. The storm was also depicted in several documentaries and news specials.

#Retirement

The name "Ian" was retired from the list of Atlantic hurricane names in 2023, due to the significant damage and loss of life caused by the storm.

* List of Category 4 hurricanes in the Atlantic Basin
* List of costliest hurricanes in the United States

#Notes

* This article is a general overview of Hurricane Ian. For more detailed information, please see the references below.

#References

* National Weather Service. (2022). Hurricane Ian.

article:
Christianization of the Roman Empire as Diffusion of Innovation

The Christianization of the Roman Empire is a complex historical process that has been studied by scholars from various disciplines. One approach to understanding this phenomenon is through the lens of network theory and diffusion of innovation. This article explores how the spread of Christianity throughout the Roman Empire can be seen as a diffusion of innovation, highlighting the key characteristics and factors that contributed to its success.

# Network theory and Diffusion of innovation as an approach

Network theory and diffusion of innovation provide a useful framework for analyzing the spread of Christianity in the Roman Empire. This approach focuses on how new ideas, technologies, or practices are communicated and adopted within a social network. The diffusion of innovation model, developed by Everett Rogers, identifies five key characteristics that influence the adoption of an innovation: relative advantage, compatibility, complexity, trialability, and observability.

## Innovation

In the context of the Christianization of the Roman Empire, Christianity can be seen as an innovation that offered a new way of understanding the world, a new moral framework, and a new sense of community. Christianity presented a distinct set of beliefs and practices that differed from the traditional Roman polytheistic religion. The innovation of Christianity was not just a new set of ideas but also a new way of organizing social relationships and community life.

## Alternative approaches

Other approaches to understanding the Christianization of the Roman Empire, such as the "top-down" model, which emphasizes the role of imperial patronage and coercion, or the "bottom-up" model, which focuses on the grassroots spread of Christianity, have limitations. The network theory and diffusion of innovation approach provides a more nuanced understanding of the complex social dynamics involved in the spread of Christianity.

## Failure of diffusion

The diffusion of innovation model also highlights the potential for failure in the adoption of an innovation. In the case of the Christianization of the Roman Empire, there were certainly instances of resistance and failure, particularly in the early centuries. However, the model also suggests that innovation can be adapted and modified to better suit the needs of the adopting population, which is precisely what happened in the case of Christianity.

# Five characteristics of diffusion

The diffusion of innovation model identifies five key characteristics that influence the adoption of an innovation. These characteristics are relative advantage, compatibility, complexity, trialability, and observability.

## Relative advantage

The relative advantage of an innovation refers to the degree to which it offers a better solution to a problem or need than existing alternatives. In the case of Christianity, its relative advantage lay in its ability to provide a sense of community, moral guidance, and spiritual meaning in a world that was increasingly complex and uncertain.

### Alms

One of the key ways in which Christianity demonstrated its relative advantage was through its emphasis on almsgiving and charitable works. Christians were encouraged to care for the poor, the sick, and the marginalized, which not only provided a sense of purpose and meaning but also helped to build a sense of community.

### Slavery through the fifth century

Christianity also offered a relative advantage in its approach to slavery. While slavery was a widespread institution in the Roman Empire, Christianity taught that all people were equal in the eyes of God, which helped to undermine the legitimacy of slavery. As Christianity spread, attitudes towards slavery began to shift, and by the fifth century, slavery had begun to decline.

### Geography and a scale-free network

The geography of the Roman Empire, with its extensive network of roads, cities, and trade routes, also facilitated the spread of Christianity. The scale-free network of the empire, in which a small number of highly connected nodes (cities) were linked to a large number of less connected nodes (towns and villages), allowed ideas and innovations to spread quickly and efficiently.

## Compatibility and complexity

The compatibility of an innovation refers to the degree to which it is consistent with existing values, norms, and practices. Christianity, as an innovation, was not entirely compatible with existing Roman values and practices, particularly in its early stages. However, as it spread, Christianity adapted and modified itself to become more compatible with Roman culture.

## Trialability

The trialability of an innovation refers to the degree to which it can be tested and experimented with. Christianity, as an innovation, offered a range of practices and rituals that could be tried and tested, from prayer and worship to almsgiving and charitable works.

### Reinvention

One of the key ways in which Christianity demonstrated its trialability was through its ability to reinvent itself. As the innovation spread, different communities and individuals adapted and modified it to suit their needs and circumstances. This process of reinvention allowed Christianity to remain relevant and dynamic, even as the Roman Empire underwent significant changes.

## Observability

The observability of an innovation refers to the degree to which its results and benefits can be seen and observed. Christianity, as an innovation, offered a range of observable benefits, from the sense of community and belonging it provided to the moral guidance and spiritual meaning it offered.

### Innovators of the first century

The innovators of the first century, such as Jesus and the apostles, played a crucial role in spreading Christianity. They not only developed the innovation but also demonstrated its relative advantage, compatibility, and trialability.

### Early adopters in the first and second centuries

The early adopters of the first and second centuries, such as the communities in Antioch and Alexandria, also played a significant role in spreading Christianity. They not only adopted the innovation but also adapted and modified it to suit their needs and circumstances.

### Third century early majority

The third century saw the emergence of the early majority, who adopted Christianity in large numbers. This group included people from a wide range of backgrounds and social classes, who were attracted to the innovation's relative advantage, compatibility, and trialability.

#### Sexual morality

One of the key areas in which Christianity demonstrated its relative advantage was in its approach to sexual morality. Christianity taught that all people were equal in the eyes of God, regardless of their sex or social status, which helped to undermine the legitimacy of patriarchal attitudes towards women.

#### Persecution

Despite its growing popularity, Christianity faced significant persecution in the third century, particularly under the emperors Decius and Diocletian. However, this persecution also helped to galvanize the Christian community, who saw themselves as martyrs for their faith.

# Constantine as opinion leader

Constantine, who became emperor in 306 CE, played a crucial role in the spread of Christianity. As an opinion leader, he helped to legitimize the innovation and provide it with a sense of authority and prestige. Constantine's conversion to Christianity, which is traditionally dated to 312 CE, marked a significant turning point in the history of the Roman Empire and the spread of Christianity.

# Notes

This article has provided an overview of the Christianization of the Roman Empire as a diffusion of innovation. It has highlighted the key characteristics of the innovation, including its relative advantage, compatibility, complexity, trialability, and observability. It has also explored the role of opinion leaders, such as Constantine, in spreading the innovation.

# References

This article has not included any references or citations.

# Bibliography

This article has not included a bibliography.

# Further reading

Readers who are interested in learning more about the Christianization of the Roman Empire and the diffusion of innovation may wish to consult the following sources:

* Everett Rogers, Diffusion of Innovations (5th ed.)
* Rodney Stark, The Rise of Christianity: A Sociologist Reconsiders History
* Peter Brown, The Rise of Western Christendom: Triumph and Diversity, AD 200-1000

article:
Blonde (2022 film)

Blonde is a 2022 biographical drama film written and directed by Andrew Dominik, based on the 2000 novel of the same name by Joyce Carol Oates. The film is a fictionalized account of the life of Marilyn Monroe, played by Ana de Armas, and explores her struggles with fame, mental health, and relationships. Blonde premiered at the 79th Venice International Film Festival and was released on Netflix in September 2022.

#Plot

The film is a non-linear narrative that jumps back and forth in time, exploring different periods of Marilyn Monroe's life. The story begins with Marilyn as a young girl, Norma Jeane, growing up in a foster home and struggling with the trauma of her past. As she grows older, she becomes a successful model and actress, but her mental health begins to deteriorate. The film follows her relationships with her husbands, Joe DiMaggio and Arthur Miller, as well as her struggles with the pressures of fame and the objectification of her body.

Throughout the film, Marilyn's inner life is explored through a series of fragmented and dreamlike sequences, which blur the lines between reality and fantasy. These sequences are often surreal and unsettling, conveying the sense of disorientation and disconnection that Marilyn feels as she navigates the complexities of her life.

#Cast

* Ana de Armas as Marilyn Monroe
* Adrien Brody as Arthur Miller
* Bobby Cannavale as Joe DiMaggio
* Xavier Samuel as Charles "Cass" Chaplin Jr.
* Julianne Nicholson as Gladys Pearl Baker
* Evan Williams as Edward G. Robinson Jr.
* Toby Huss as Allan "Whitey" Snyder
* David Corenswet as Tony Curtis
* Rebecca Wisocky as Yvet

#Production

##Development and writing

Andrew Dominik began working on the script for Blonde in 2010, after reading Joyce Carol Oates' novel of the same name. Dominik was drawn to the novel's complex and nuanced portrayal of Marilyn Monroe, and he saw an opportunity to explore the inner life of a woman who had been mythologized and objectified by the media. Over the course of several years, Dominik worked on the script, researching Marilyn's life and developing a fictionalized narrative that would capture the essence of her experiences.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on Blonde began in 2019, with Dominik assembling a team of collaborators to help bring the film to life. The production designer, Laura Fox, worked closely with Dominik to create a detailed and accurate recreation of Marilyn's world, from the sets and costumes to the props and makeup. The cinematographer, Chayse Irvin, developed a visual strategy that would capture the sense of disorientation and disconnection that Marilyn feels throughout the film.

##Casting

Ana de Armas was cast as Marilyn Monroe in 2019, after a lengthy casting process. Dominik had seen de Armas in her previous films and was impressed by her range and vulnerability. De Armas spent several months preparing for the role, researching Marilyn's life and working with a dialect coach to develop her accent and mannerisms.

##Filming

Principal photography on Blonde began in August 2019 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in Los Angeles and New York City, with a crew of over 100 people. The shoot was often intense and demanding, with long hours and complex scenes to capture. De Armas performed many of her own stunts and worked closely with the stunt team to create a sense of realism and authenticity.

##Music

The score for Blonde was composed by Nick Cave and Warren Ellis, who had previously collaborated with Dominik on his film The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford. The score is a mix of original compositions and period songs, which help to capture the mood and atmosphere of the film. The soundtrack also features several of Marilyn's own songs, including "Diamonds Are a Girl's Best Friend" and "I'm Through with Love".

#Release

Blonde premiered at the 79th Venice International Film Festival in September 2022, where it received a mixed response from critics. The film was released on Netflix in the United States and other countries on September 28, 2022.

#Reception

##Critical response

Blonde received a mixed response from critics, with some praising the film's ambition and performances, while others criticized its length and graphic content. The film holds a 44% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 220 reviews, with an average rating of 5.2/10. The critical consensus on the site reads: "Ana de Armas shines as Marilyn Monroe, but Blonde's excessive length and graphic content make for a challenging viewing experience."

##Industry reception

Blonde was also met with a mixed response from industry professionals, with some praising the film's technical achievements and others criticizing its depiction of Marilyn Monroe. The film's NC-17 rating was a subject of controversy, with some arguing that it was justified by the film's graphic content, while others felt that it was excessive and gratuitous.

##Cast

The cast of Blonde received widespread praise for their performances, with Ana de Armas being singled out for her portrayal of Marilyn Monroe. Adrien Brody and Bobby Cannavale also received praise for their supporting performances, with many critics noting that they added depth and nuance to the film.

##NC-17 rating

Blonde received an NC-17 rating from the Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA) due to its graphic content, including scenes of nudity, sex, and violence. The rating was a subject of controversy, with some arguing that it was justified by the film's themes and content, while others felt that it was excessive and gratuitous.

##Criticism about depiction of abortion

Blonde was also criticized for its depiction of abortion, with some arguing that it was gratuitous and exploitative. The film includes a scene in which Marilyn undergoes an abortion, which some critics felt was unnecessary and disturbing. Others argued that the scene was an important part of the film's narrative and helped to convey the sense of trauma and disconnection that Marilyn feels throughout the film.

##Accolades

Blonde received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival. Ana de Armas also received several awards and nominations for her performance, including a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress.

article:
Tony Bennett
================

Anthony Dominick Benedetto, known professionally as Tony Bennett, was an American singer of popular music, standards, and jazz. With a career spanning over 70 years, Bennett was one of the most enduring and iconic vocalists of all time, known for his rich, smooth, and expressive voice, as well as his interpretive skills as a singer.

Early Life
------------

### 1926–1943: Family and education

Tony Bennett was born on August 3, 1926, in Long Island City, Queens, New York, to Anna (née Suraci) and John Benedetto. He was the eldest of three children, and his parents were both of Italian-American descent. Bennett's father was a grocer, and the family lived a modest life in a small apartment in Queens. From an early age, Bennett was drawn to music, and his mother encouraged his interest by taking him to concerts and musicals.

Bennett attended the High School of Industrial Art in Manhattan, where he studied music and painting. He was heavily influenced by jazz and blues music, and he spent much of his teenage years listening to the likes of Billie Holiday, Ella Fitzgerald, and Louis Armstrong.

### 1944–1950: World War II and after

In 1944, Bennett was drafted into the United States Army during World War II. He served in the infantry and was stationed in Germany, where he participated in the liberation of a concentration camp. After the war, Bennett attended the American Theatre Wing, where he studied drama and music. He began performing in local nightclubs and bars, singing and playing piano.

Career
---------

### 1951–1959: First successes

In 1951, Bennett was discovered by Pearl Bailey, who helped him secure a recording contract with Columbia Records. His first single, "Because of You," was released in 1951 and became a huge success, reaching number one on the Billboard charts. Over the next few years, Bennett released several successful singles, including "Rags to Riches" and "Stranger in Paradise."

Bennett's early success was largely due to his unique vocal style, which blended elements of jazz, pop, and classical music. He was known for his smooth, expressive voice and his interpretive skills as a singer.

### 1954–1965: A growing artistry

In the mid-1950s, Bennett began to develop his artistry as a singer. He released several critically acclaimed albums, including "Cloud 7" and "The Beat of My Heart." He also began to work with some of the top arrangers and conductors of the day, including Ralph Burns and Frank De Vol.

Bennett's live performances were also becoming increasingly popular, and he began to tour extensively throughout the United States and Europe. He was known for his charismatic stage presence and his ability to connect with audiences.

### 1965–1979: Years of struggle

In the late 1960s, Bennett's popularity began to wane. He was struggling to find his place in a rapidly changing musical landscape, and his record sales began to decline. He continued to tour and perform, but he was no longer the dominant force he had once been.

Despite his struggles, Bennett continued to release new music, and he experimented with different styles and genres. He released several albums that were more rock-oriented, and he worked with some of the top musicians of the day, including Stevie Wonder and Elton John.

### 1979–1989: Turnaround

In 1979, Bennett's son, Danny, took over as his manager and helped him to revitalize his career. Danny Bennett encouraged his father to return to his roots as a jazz singer and to focus on his live performances.

Bennett's live shows were met with critical acclaim, and he began to attract a new, younger audience. He also began to release new music, including several critically acclaimed albums, such as "The Art of Excellence" and "Astoria: Portrait of the Artist."

### 1990–2006: Established career

Throughout the 1990s and early 2000s, Bennett's career continued to flourish. He released several successful albums, including "Unplugged" and "Playin' with My Friends." He also continued to tour extensively and to perform with some of the top musicians of the day.

Bennett's awards and accolades during this period included multiple Grammy Awards, as well as a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

### 2006–2021: Later years and final album

In 2006, Bennett released his album "Duets: An American Classic," which featured collaborations with some of the top artists of the day, including Stevie Wonder, Elton John, and Billy Joel.

Over the next several years, Bennett continued to tour and perform, despite his advancing age. He released several more albums, including "Viva Duets" and "Cheek to Cheek," a collaborative album with Lady Gaga.

In 2021, Bennett released his final album, "Love for Sale," a collaborative album with Lady Gaga.

Artistry
------------

### Painting

In addition to his work as a singer, Bennett was also a talented painter. He had a studio in his home in New York City, where he would often spend hours painting and sketching.

Bennett's artwork was highly regarded, and he had several exhibitions throughout his career. He was particularly known for his portraits, which captured the essence and personality of his subjects.

### Musical style

Bennett's musical style was unique and eclectic, blending elements of jazz, pop, and classical music. He was known for his smooth, expressive voice and his interpretive skills as a singer.

Bennett's approach to singing was highly personal and intuitive. He would often listen to a song multiple times, absorbing the lyrics and the melody, before interpreting it in his own way.

Awards and Legacy
-----------------

Throughout his career, Bennett won numerous awards and accolades, including multiple Grammy Awards, as well as a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Bennett's legacy as a singer is immeasurable. He was one of the most enduring and iconic vocalists of all time, known for his rich, smooth, and expressive voice, as well as his interpretive skills as a singer.

Works
--------

### Discography

* "Because of You" (1951)
* "Cloud 7" (1955)

### Books

* "What My Heart Has Seen" (1996) - a collection of Bennett's artwork and writings.
* "The Good Life" (1998) - a memoir.
* "Tony Bennett: What My Heart Has Seen" (2008) - a collection of Bennett's artwork and writings.

Personal Life
-------------

Bennett was known for his warm and charismatic personality. He was a devoted husband and father, and he was deeply committed to his family.

Bennett was married to Susan Crow, a former schoolteacher, for over 50 years. The couple had two children together, Danny and Dae Bennett.

Politics
------------

Bennett was a lifelong Democrat and was active in politics throughout his career. He was a strong supporter of the Civil Rights Movement and was a vocal advocate for social justice.

Illness and Death
-----------------

In 2016, Bennett announced that he had been diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. Despite his illness, he continued to tour and perform, albeit with some modifications to his live shows.

Tony Bennett passed away on July 21, 2023, at the age of 96, surrounded by his family.

article:
Ștefan Foriș

Ștefan Foriș was a Romanian communist politician who served as the General Secretary of the Romanian Communist Party (PCR) from 1944 to 1945. His tenure was marked by a series of tumultuous events, including the outlawing of the PCR, the adoption of the "popular front" tactic, and the eventual takeover of the party. Foriș's life was cut short when he was killed in 1946, under mysterious circumstances.

#Biography

##Early life

Ștefan Foriș was born on May 26, 1892, in Coșevița, a small village in the county of Timiș, Romania. His family was of peasant origin, and his parents were both farmers. Foriș's early life was marked by poverty and hardship, but he managed to secure a place at the local school, where he demonstrated a keen intellect and a passion for learning.

After completing his secondary education, Foriș moved to Budapest, where he enrolled in the University of Budapest to study philosophy. It was during his time at university that Foriș became interested in socialism and communism, and he began to read the works of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels.

##PCR outlawing

In 1921, Foriș returned to Romania and joined the Socialist Party of Romania, which later became the Romanian Communist Party (PCR). However, the PCR was outlawed in 1924, and Foriș was forced to go underground. Despite the risks, Foriș continued to be active in the party, and he played a key role in organizing strikes and protests.

##"Popular front" tactic

In the mid-1930s, the PCR adopted the "popular front" tactic, which involved forming alliances with other left-wing parties and organizations. Foriș was a strong supporter of this tactic, and he played a key role in building relationships with other parties.

##Taking over

In 1944, Foriș became the General Secretary of the PCR, following the death of the previous leader, Constantin Diamandescu. Foriș's leadership was marked by a series of radical policies, including the nationalization of industry and the collectivization of agriculture.

##Resisting the resistance

Foriș's leadership was also marked by a series of struggles against the fascist and nationalist forces that were opposed to the PCR. The party faced resistance from the Iron Guard, a fascist organization that had been responsible for numerous violent attacks on communists and other left-wing activists.

##Caransebeș conspiracy

In 1945, Foriș was involved in a conspiracy to overthrow the government of General Nicolae Rădescu. The conspiracy, which became known as the Caransebeș conspiracy, was unsuccessful, and Foriș was forced to go into hiding.

##Capture

In 1946, Foriș was captured by the authorities and imprisoned. Despite his imprisonment, Foriș continued to be a powerful figure in the PCR, and he played a key role in shaping the party's policies.

##Killing

On August 29, 1946, Foriș was killed in prison, under mysterious circumstances. The official explanation was that Foriș had died of a heart attack, but many suspected that he had been murdered.

#Legacy

##Cover-up and rumors

Following Foriș's death, there were numerous rumors and allegations of a cover-up. Many believed that Foriș had been murdered by the authorities, and that his death had been covered up to avoid a scandal.

##Rehabilitation

In the 1960s, Foriș's reputation was rehabilitated, and he was recognized as a hero of the Romanian communist movement. However, the circumstances of his death remained a mystery, and many questions remained unanswered.

#Personal life and family

Foriș was married to a woman named Lucreția, and the couple had two children together. Despite his busy schedule, Foriș was known to be a devoted family man, and he was deeply committed to his wife and children.

#Notes
